camel.source.path.fileSystemName.name: camel.source.path.fileSystemName
camel.source.path.fileSystemName.description: name of filesystem to be used

camel.source.endpoint.close.name: camel.source.endpoint.close
camel.source.endpoint.close.description: Whether or not a file changed event raised indicates completion (true) or modification (false)

camel.source.endpoint.closeStreamAfterRe.name: camel.source.endpoint.closeStreamAfterRead
camel.source.endpoint.closeStreamAfterRe.description: check for closing stream after read

camel.source.endpoint.dataCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.dataCount
camel.source.endpoint.dataCount.description: count number of bytes to download

camel.source.endpoint.directoryName.name: camel.source.endpoint.directoryName
camel.source.endpoint.directoryName.description: directory of the file to be handled in component

camel.source.endpoint.fileDir.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileDir
camel.source.endpoint.fileDir.description: directory of file to do operations in the local system

camel.source.endpoint.fileName.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileName
camel.source.endpoint.fileName.description: name of file to be handled in component

camel.source.endpoint.fileOffset.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileOffset
camel.source.endpoint.fileOffset.description: offset position in file for different operations

camel.source.endpoint.maxResults.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxResults
camel.source.endpoint.maxResults.description: maximum number of results to show at a time

camel.source.endpoint.maxRetryRequests.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxRetryRequests
camel.source.endpoint.maxRetryRequests.description: no of retries to a given request

camel.source.endpoint.openOptions.name: camel.source.endpoint.openOptions
camel.source.endpoint.openOptions.description: set open options for creating file

camel.source.endpoint.path.name: camel.source.endpoint.path
camel.source.endpoint.path.description: path in azure datalake for operations

camel.source.endpoint.position.name: camel.source.endpoint.position
camel.source.endpoint.position.description: This parameter allows the caller to upload data in parallel and control the order in which it is appended to the file.

camel.source.endpoint.regex.name: camel.source.endpoint.regex
camel.source.endpoint.regex.description: regular expression for matching file names

camel.source.endpoint.retainUncommitedDa.name: camel.source.endpoint.retainUncommitedData
camel.source.endpoint.retainUncommitedDa.description: Whether or not uncommitted data is to be retained after the operation

camel.source.endpoint.serviceClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.serviceClient
camel.source.endpoint.serviceClient.description: datalake service client for azure storage datalake

camel.source.endpoint.sharedKeyCredentia.name: camel.source.endpoint.sharedKeyCredential
camel.source.endpoint.sharedKeyCredentia.description: shared key credential for azure datalake gen2

camel.source.endpoint.userPrincipalNameR.name: camel.source.endpoint.userPrincipalNameReturned
camel.source.endpoint.userPrincipalNameR.description: whether or not to use upn

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.c.description: Whether or not a file changed event raised indicates completion (true) or modification (false)

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.f.description: directory of file to do operations in the local system

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.f.description: offset position in file for different operations

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.m.description: maximum number of results to show at a time

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.m.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.maxRetryRequests
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.m.description: no of retries to a given request

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.o.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.openOptions
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.o.description: set open options for creating file

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.p.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.path
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.p.description: path in azure datalake for operations

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.p.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.position
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.p.description: This parameter allows the caller to upload data in parallel and control the order in which it is appended to the file.

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.r.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.regex
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.r.description: regular expression for matching file names

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.r.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.retainUncommitedData
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.r.description: Whether or not uncommitted data is to be retained after the operation

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.s.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.serviceClient
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.s.description: datalake service client for azure storage datalake

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.s.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.sharedKeyCredential
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.s.description: shared key credential for azure datalake gen2

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.u.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.userPrincipalNameReturned
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.u.description: whether or not to use upn

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.b.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.b.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.a.name: camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.azure-storage-datalake.a.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
